COMMENT—
Section 410 deﬁnes stolen property. A property is stolen for the purpose of this section
when its possession is transferred by theft, extortion, robbery, dacoity or criminal
breach of trust or which was obtained under misappropriation committed whether in
India or outside. An extended meaning is given to the words 'stolen property' which are
used in the four subsequent sections. Not only things which have been stolen, extorted
or robbed but also things which have been obtained by criminal misappropriation or
criminal breach of trust are within the meaning assigned to these words. Section 411
provides punishment to the person who dishonestly receives stolen property. The
person must have the knowledge that it is a stolen property.
